title: 2D+1D Decomposition of InSAR for Landslide Application
text:
Introduction
The 2D+1D decomposition technique is
Understanding the 2D+1D Decomposition
Traditional InSAR methods rely on line-of-sight (LOS) measurements, which are inherently limited to one-dimensional deformation signals. The 2D+1D decomposition method extends this by: - Resolving horizontal and vertical components. - Enhancing accuracy in complex terrains like high-mountain regions.
Key Applications
The technique finds its applications in: - Monitoring slow-moving landslides. - Studying deformation in permafrost areas. - Investigating seismic cycles and fault interactions.
Advantages

Enhanced Resolution: Captures subtle deformation signals in challenging environments.
Improved Accuracy: Reduces errors introduced by atmospheric and topographic effects.
Broad Applicability: Works across various geohazard scenarios.

Conclusion
The 2D+1D decomposition technique represents a significant leap in InSAR-based geohazard analysis. Its potential to transform our understanding of landslides and related processes is immense. Stay tuned for more in-depth discussions and case studies in future posts!
References - Relevant Paper 1 - Relevant Paper 2

title: About Me
text:
Research Interests:

Remote sensing (microwave and optical)
InSAR techniques and time series analysis
Hillslope processes and seismic cycles

title: Welcome to My Academic Portfolio
text:
Mohammad Mohseni Aref


Hi, I’m Mohammad Mohseni Aref, a Ph.D. candidate in Remote Sensing at Potsdam University, Germany. My research focuses on remote sensing, InSAR techniques, atmospheric corrections and deformation modeling.

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Education

Ph.D. student in Remote Sensing , Potsdam University, Germany
M.Sc. in Water Resources Engineering, Azad University, Iran (2011)
B.Sc. in Water and Irrigation Engineering, Bahoonar University, Iran (2007)

title: Publications
text:
M. Mohseni Aref, B. Bookhagen, and R. Strecker, “Impact of Tropospheric Delay Correction on the Quality of Landslide Mapping in the Southern Central Andes, Northwestern Argentina,” EGU General Assembly, Vienna, Austria, Apr. 2024. [DOI]





M. Mohseni Aref, B. Bookhagen, and R. Strecker, “Using InSAR time series to characterize landslide deformation dynamics in the south-central Andes,” EGU General Assembly, Vienna, Austria, Apr. 2023. [DOI]
M. Metz, B. Maleki Asayesh, M. Mohseni Aref, et al., “The July-December 2022 earthquake sequence in the southeastern Fars arc of Zagros mountains, Iran,” Seismica, vol. 2, no. 2, Oct. 2023. [DOI]





M. Mohseni Aref, B. Bookhagen, and R. Strecker, “Kinematics Characterization of Slow-Moving Landslide using InSAR Time Series Analysis in the South-Central Andes of NW Argentina,” EGU General Assembly, Vienna, Austria, May 2022. [DOI]





F.C. Çomut and M. Mohseni Aref, “Interpretation of Mw 6.8 Elazığ Earthquake (24.01.2020) Crisis Management System in terms of Satellite Borne Radar Interferometry Observations,” Advances in the Science and Applications of SAR Interferometry, Online Event, May-Jun. 2021.
M. Mohseni Aref, B. Bookhagen, and R. Strecker, “Evolution of Large Bedrock Landslides in the South-Central Andes of NW Argentina,” EGU General Assembly, Online, Apr. 2021. [DOI]

M. Albayrak, M.T. Özlüdemir, M.M. Aref, and K. Halicioglu, “Determination of Istanbul geoid using GNSS/levelling and valley cross levelling data,” Geod. Geodyn., vol. 11, 2020.
M. Albayrak, K. Halicioğlu, M.T. Özlüdemir, B. Başoğlu, R. Deniz, A.R.B. Tyler, and M.M. Aref, “The use of the automated digital zenith camera system in Istanbul for the determination of astrogeodetic vertical deflection,” Bol. Ciencias Geod., vol. 25, no. 4, 2020.





M. Mohseni Aref and E. Tari, “Geodetic Observation and Analysis of Land Deformation in Northwest of Iran,” EGU General Assembly Conference Abstracts, vol. 21, 2019.





M. Mohseni Aref, Z. Cakir, and S. Karimzadeh, “Interseismic accumulation across the Khoy fault from InSAR measurement,” EGU General Assembly Conference Abstracts, vol. 18, p. 828, 2016.





T. Torres and M. Mohseni Aref, “Monitoring of Three Case Studies of Creeping Landslides in Ecuador Using L-band SAR Interferometry (InSAR),” 2015 Fall Meeting, AGU, San Francisco, CA, 2015.
E. Khesali, H. Enayati, M. Modiri, and M. Mohseni Aref, “Automatic Ship Detection In SINGLE-POL SAR Images Using Texture Feature In Artificial Neural Networks,” ISPRS - Int. Arch. Photogramm. Remote Sens. Spat. Inf. Sci., vol. XL-1-W5, pp. 395-399, Dec. 2015.
F. Comut, A. Ustun, M. Lazecky, and M. Mohseni Aref, “Multi Band InSAR Analysis Of Subsidence Development Based On The Long Period Time Series,” ISPRS - Int. Arch. Photogramm. Remote Sens. Spat. Inf. Sci., vol. XL-1-W5, pp. 115-121, Dec. 2015.





M. Mohseni Aref and M. Motagh, “InSAR time series analysis of land deformation: northwest of Iran,” International on Advances in the Science and Applications of SAR Interferometry, Frascati (Rome), Italy, Sep. 2011.
